item.title: Welcome to my new blog . . . again!
item.description: Earlier this year I moved my blog to Jekyll. It was fun while it lasted. I’ve decided to give Hugo a try. The main reason is that I wanted something I could easily from either my Windows or Mac machines. I didn’t want to mess with installing or configuring Ruby gems. I’m giving Hugo a try. I expect to change the theme and make tweaks over the coming weeks.

item.title: Azure Functions Private Site Access
item.description: This post will demonstrate how to create an Azure Function with private site access. Private site access refers to a way for resources within a virtual network to reach out to an Azure Function. Configuring private site access ensures that the specified Azure Function is not able to be triggered via the public internet. Instead, the function can only be accessed via a specific virtual network. The function is private to the specified virtual network.

item.title: Welcome to my new blog!
item.description: Welcome to my new blog! I’ve decided to try an experiment and change my personal blog from Wordpress.com to Jekyll with GitHub Pages. I’ll keep my old blog at https://michaelcollier.wordpress.com around, but will (assuming this experiment works out) not be posting more there.
